phokimo.src.io.terachem

A tool to extract information from terachem outputs.

Classes

TeraChemOutputReader(fname)

Extract information from TeraChem outputs.
class phokimo.src.io.terachem.TeraChemOutputReader(fname: str)

Extract information from TeraChem outputs.

__init__(fname: str) → None

Extract information from TeraChem outputs.

Reads in the file of the TeraChem and checks if it finished. Otherwise AssertionError will be raised.

Parameters:

fname (_type_) – filename of the output file.

check_convergence() → bool

Checks if a calculation is converged.

Searches in the last 200 lines of the file if ‘Converged!’ is part of a line. Otherwise it is considered that the computation did not finish.

Returns:

True if converged otherwise False

Return type:

bool

energy() → float

Extract the final energy from the output.

Searches for the keyword ‘FINAL ENERGY’ in the file and extracts from this line the energy.

Returns:

energy

Return type:

float

ci_energy(max_roots: int = 3) → tuple

Reads configurational interaction energies and oscillator strength.

!CAUTION! There is no distinguishment between singlet and triplet, or other, states.

Parameters:

max_roots (int, optional) – Number of roots to extract from. Defaults to 3.

Returns:

energies (Eh) and oscillator strengths (-)

Return type:

tuple

state_dipole_moment(max_roots: int = 996) → ndarray

Extract the state dipole moments.

Parameters:

max_roots (int, optional) – Number of dipole moments to be extracted. Defaults to 996.

Returns:

State dipole moments

Return type:

np.ndarray

transition_dipole_moment(max_roots: int = 996) → DataFrame

Extract transition dipole moments.

Parameters:

  • max_roots (int, optional) – Number of roots to consider for the transition dipole moments. Defaults to 996.

  • given. (Every state pair is put into the dataframe. In each case the 'intial' and 'final' states are)

  • coordinates (The dipole moment are given in cartesian)

Returns:

returns a data frame with initial and final states as dipole and its norm.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

scf_iterations(max_steps: int = 101) → DataFrame

Returns the last scf iteration.

Parameters:

max_steps (int, optional) – Number of steps that should be used. Defaults to 101.

Returns:

Table of information for the scf.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

transition_electric_dipole_moment(max_roots: int = 996) → DataFrame

Extract electric transition dipole moments, energies and oscillator strengths.

Parameters:

  • max_roots (int, optional) – Number of roots to consider for the transition dipole moments. Defaults to 996.

  • given. (Every state pair is put into the dataframe. In each case the 'final' state is)

  • cartesian (The electric transition dipole moment are given in)

  • coordinates (access via 'x', 'y', 'z')

Returns:

table of information of electric transition dipole moment.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

plot_spectrum(ax: axis.Axis, X: np.ndarray, Y: np.ndarray, xmin: float = -inf, xmax: float = inf, xstep: int = 1, gamma: float = 10) → None

Plots a spectrum of gaussian smeared variables.

Parameters:

  • ax (axis.Axis) – Axis on which the spectrum is plotted.

  • X (np.ndarray) – x values

  • Y (np.ndarray) – y values

  • xmin (float | None, optional) – minimal value for x values . Defaults to None.

  • xmax (float | None, optional) – maximal value for x values. Defaults to None.

  • xstep (int | None, optional) – stepsize for x . Defaults to None.

  • gamma (float, optional) – smearing constant. Defaults to 10.
